# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    lines = String[]

    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " " * word) <= text_width
            current_line = current_line * (isempty(current_line) ? "" : " ") * word
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Here is an example of how to use this function:

```julia
str = "This is a long string that will be wrapped at the given text width"
println(wrap_string(str)) # Text will wrap according to default text_width=10
println(wrap_string(str, 20)) # Text will wrap according to specified text_width=20
```
